ref: 10371 mauna n. ʻ silence ʼ MBh., ʻ barrenness, lack of flowers ʼ Bhām. 2. *mūna -- . 3. *mōnna -- . [These words (*mōnna -- poss., but prob. not, < *maunya -- ) belong to a group of ʻ defective ʼ words (*munna -- &c. s.v. *mutta -- ) or of words meaning ʻ dumb ʼ s.v. mūˊka -- . They are to be separated from mauná -- ʻ state of a muni ʼ ŚBr., Pa. mōna -- n. ʻ saintly wisdom ʼ (der. from *munāti1)]
K. mōn m. ʻ silence, taciturnity ʼ, mūnu ʻ taciturn, motionless ʼ: or < 3.
